Reviews.Content: nothing else but cheap the place does not really deserve the name hotel - it is rather a motel. The room was dirty and the beds were terrible. fortunately we just had to spend there one night. the so called hotel is located right in the middle of nowhere - you need a car. The staff was quiete friendly. Avoid the dinner it is far overpriced and of terrible quality. Food in general is very expensive (cup of coffee 6.5 鈧? at this hotel because you can't really go anywhere else and they take advantage of this!!!. Unless you bring your one food and you don't intend to stay more than one night: I WiLL AVOID THIS PLACE! It is better to invest money in a better place to stay.
Reviews.Author: buangi

Reviews.Content: Middle of nowhere!! Old but Ok I booked this hotel as it was cheap and had parking and looked quite near Amsterdam. . . . it IS but the little town it is in is quite remote and we ended up (by following the sat nav) going down some very scary dark and deserted country roads.When we finally got to the right road a nice lady showed us how to get to the hotel, its kind of behind all the houses.The staff here were very friendly and could speak good english. The hotel is like an old house and very characterful and quirky. There is no lift and the stairs to the first floor are quite steap and narrow (i was carrying baby up them) the room was nice and we had an extra bed as well as there still being room for the cot. We had a tv with more than CNN - it had BBC1 and 2 !!!! rarety in europe. the bathroom had a nice showercubicle but the tray didnt drain fast enough. I got in an hour after my husband and had to stand in a tray of cold used water ugh!The rooms are quite close and we were kept up all one night by an amourous couple in the room next door.Ok but you definately need a car.
Reviews.Author: SuperiorChimp3

Reviews.Content: excellent hotel Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly, rooms are big and clean. The hotel is not far from the city centre only draw back (if it is one) there is no tea making equipment in the bedrooms (so bring your kettle). Food is good.
Reviews.Author: wearytraveller56

Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel in the Suburbs My husband and I drove to Amsterdam from Germany, and got a bit lost trying to find the place. It advertises a lot of amenities that it does not actually have. There is no swimming pool, no lift (elevator), and no actual garden, unless you count the patio out back (which we could not justifiably do). Also, if you are expecting a sea view then you had better be on the top floor, as we could only see the berm from our second story room.All that being said, the lobby, breakfast room, and room were all nice. The room had traditional decor, with a small yet funtional bathroom and a t.v. with several stations. Breakfast was continental with the usual meats, cheeses, milk, yogurt and cereal. We brought our dog, which was very nice. I enjoyed staying here because we had a chance to mix with the locals and take walks every day along the local canals. If you are staying here, YOU WILL NEED A CAR TO GET DOWNTOWN. It is about a fifteen minute drive to park downtown. It's good for the value, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: teenyrose4evr
